what: Compare epidemic curves using GAM smoothing, functional distances, clustering, and optional permutation/bootstrapping — compare_curves
title: Compare epidemic curves using GAM smoothing, functional distances, clustering, and optional permutation/bootstrapping — compare_curves
text: Fits generalized additive model (GAM) replicated disease progress curves. default, response modeled beta regression (logit link) Smithson–Verkuilen adjustment handle 0 1 values; beta precision (theta) estimation fails, model falls back quasibinomial GAM fit unclipped proportion response. fitted model, function derives () environment-adjusted treatment mean curves common time grid, (ii) L2 functional distances among treatment mean trajectories followed hierarchical clustering, (iii) curve-level fitted trajectories (excluding unit random effects) build curve--curve distance matrix. Optionally, performs restricted permutation test curve-level distance matrix priori group labels, computes bootstrap envelopes distance uncertainty summaries resampled predicted curves.

title: Compare epidemic curves using GAM smoothing, functional distances, clustering, and optional permutation/bootstrapping — compare_curves
code: compare_curves(   data,   time,   response,   treatment,   environment = NULL,   block = NULL,   unit = NULL,   response_scale = c("proportion", "percent"),   eps = 1e-04,   min_points = 5,   grid_n = 140,   env_ref = NULL,   k_smooth = 10,   k_env = 4,   k_trt = 6,   gamma = 1.4,   discrete = TRUE,   cluster_k = 4,   hc_method = "ward.D2",   test_factor = NULL,   n_perm = 999,   test_mode = c("auto", "none", "global", "global_pairwise"),   min_strata_for_pairwise = 6,   perm_unit = NULL,   perm_strata = NULL,   bootstrap = FALSE,   boot_B = 399,   boot_seed = 1,   boot_ci = c(0.025, 0.975),   bootstrap_mode = c("predicted", "refit"),   ... )

title: Compare epidemic curves using GAM smoothing, functional distances, clustering, and optional permutation/bootstrapping — compare_curves
text: data data.frame containing disease progress observations long format. time Character string naming time variable (numeric coercible numeric). response Character string naming response variable (disease incidence/severity). treatment Character string naming treatment/cultivar factor. environment Optional character string naming environment factor (e.g., site-year). block Optional character string naming blocking factor. unit Optional character string naming unique experimental unit (curve) identifier. NULL, unit constructed interaction available factors (environment, treatment, block). response_scale Character string specifying response scale: "proportion" (0–1) "percent" (0–100). eps Numeric small constant retained API compatibility (used beta handling). min_points Minimum number observations required per curve (unit) retained. grid_n Number time points evaluating predicted curves common grid. env_ref Reference environment level used adjusted treatment mean predictions. NULL, first level environment used. k_smooth Basis dimension global smooth time. k_env Basis dimension environment-specific smooth (environment provided). k_trt Basis dimension treatment-specific smooth. gamma Penalization parameter passed mgcv::bam(). discrete Logical; whether use discrete (approximate) fitting mgcv::bam(). cluster_k Number clusters used cut hierarchical tree treatments. hc_method Clustering linkage method passed stats::hclust(). test_factor Optional priori grouping used distance-based permutation test. Either () single character naming column data maps uniquely permutation unit (see perm_unit), (ii) named vector whose names permutation-unit identifiers whose values group labels. n_perm Number permutations distance-based test. test_mode Character; permutation test mode. One "auto", "none", "global", "global_pairwise". "auto", pairwise tests may disabled restricted strata support limited. min_strata_for_pairwise Minimum number strata levels (e.g., blocks) required enable pairwise tests test_mode = "auto". perm_unit Optional character naming unit group labels permuted (e.g., genotype/cultivar). NULL, permutation performed curve (unit) level. perm_strata Optional character naming factor defining restricted permutation strata (e.g., block environment). NULL, defaults block provided. bootstrap Logical; TRUE, compute bootstrap envelopes distance summaries resampled predicted curves. boot_B Integer number bootstrap replicates. boot_seed Integer seed bootstrap resampling. boot_ci Length-2 numeric vector quantiles bootstrap intervals (e.g., c(0.025, 0.975)). bootstrap_mode Character; bootstrap strategy. Currently supports "predicted" (resampling predicted curves). "refit" implemented version. ... Reserved future extensions.

title: Compare epidemic curves using GAM smoothing, functional distances, clustering, and optional permutation/bootstrapping — compare_curves
text: object class "r4pde_compare_curves" containing: gam: fitted GAM object family_used; pred: environment-adjusted treatment mean curves common grid; distance: treatment--treatment functional distance matrix hc; clusters: treatment cluster assignments summary scores; curve_distance: curve--curve distance matrix; test: optional distance-based permutation test results; bootstrap: optional bootstrap envelopes distance summaries; diagnostic fields including settings captured beta-fit warnings.

title: Compare epidemic curves using GAM smoothing, functional distances, clustering, and optional permutation/bootstrapping — compare_curves
text: Functional distances among treatments computed L2 norm predicted mean curves evaluated common time grid. Curve-level distances computed analogously using fitted trajectories (excluding unit random effects), scaled median non-zero distance numerical stability; interpret distances relative rather absolute units. permutation test uses PERMANOVA-like pseudo-\(F\) statistic computed curve-level distance matrix, optional restricted permutations within strata. enabled, pairwise comparisons adjusted using Holm's method.
